WorkshopStrengths: Methodical approach
Great support. Nicely explained/appropriate pace and attention to the attendees
WorkshopImprovements: Focus more on R. Forget about the GitHub part.

WorkshopStrengths: The instructors were wonderful. We ran into some problems, and they were very patient and did their best to solve them.
WorkshopImprovements: I can't think of any. Maybe update the pre-workshop instructions so they are more in line with current versions of things.
InstructorsOpenEnded: Providing specific instructions about how to navigate to load some data.

WorkshopStrengths: having us use our own laptops.  the post-it notes were clever.
WorkshopImprovements: having a data analysis goal that we accomplish from start to finish.  anything we did with the data was hodge-podge.

WorkshopStrengths: Clear, concise instructions using effective and familiar datasets.
WorkshopImprovements: Make sure the pre-instruction setups for installing the workshop software is up to date and clear.
AccessibilityResponse: There were a few issues with using our university issued laptops and accessing R program downloads, they eventually downloaded but it took an inordinate amount of time and was disruptive toward the flow and continuity of the workshop.
InstructorsOpenEnded: Despite some snags with loading workshop software and some R downloadable programs, both instructors handled the disruptions well and were flexible to keep the workshop on track.

WorkshopStrengths: Good step by step instructions.  Get a good underlying understanding of what the codes or scripts are doing.  Friendly and patient instructors.
WorkshopImprovements: There were a lot of issues with installing R packages especially.  Perhaps instructions could be provided before the workshop to download the appropriate R packages.
InstructorsOpenEnded: When someone in my class had a question about why something worked the way it did, the instructors took time to show us what the code or script did, and why it works that way.

WorkshopStrengths: It was great that it was truly beginner level into all the software. Even though there was a lot more you can do, it didn't seem overwhelming as they went step by step.
WorkshopImprovements: It would have been nice to have someone from IT at GVSU to help with some of the issues we were having using our work laptops.
AccessibilityResponse: R does not install in a way that you can install packages easily.  It would have been nice to have that sorted out prior to the workshop.  Otherwise everything else went flawlessly.
InstructorsOpenEnded: It was great that there was two of them.  Using sticky notes to help when you were having issues was also a great help.  That way you wouldn't have to sit with your hand up distracting other people.

WorkshopStrengths: Found the session on OpenRefine really useful because spreadsheets are a lot more accessible to most researchers with minimal coding knowledge/experience and it complements Excel and its limitations well. Would have put more time into this and less into Excel, as Excel is fairly common.  Full day for R was valuable since this was the tool I had the least experience with. Learning the piping technique was really valuable as it introduced an easy way to add many layers of analysis.   The helpers that could be regularly called upon for one-on-one support was very valuable and made the seminar run much more smoothly.
WorkshopImprovements: The GitHub session was before we learned about R and was mainly demonstrated with text-based examples. Since most people don't use plain text files for their writing it made the applications of GitHub seem obsolete. Would maybe be better to demonstrate it with datasets it is best applied for (eg code scripts)

WorkshopStrengths: Good teachers, non-threatening environment
WorkshopImprovements: More examples along the way

WorkshopStrengths: hands on experience
Communication between the teacher, helpers and the participants was great. All questions were answered and no matter what level of knowledge you have with the program you are treated all equal.
WorkshopImprovements: May be some of the concepts of R can be broken in 2 days. It was a lot of information at once.
InstructorsOpenEnded: Every question I had was answered almost immediately.  They did not just give me the answer but guided me to learn how to fin the answer if I am stuck next time.

WorkshopStrengths: There was a lot of information covered in the workshop, which was great as I now have a lot of tools and that I can use in my own research. I really liked having the online notes to follow along with - I'll definitely be using them in the future. I feel confident about being able to understand, or at least be able to interpret, basic code in R now. The instructors and tutors were all extremely helpful and very enthusiastic about the material.
WorkshopImprovements: I know that this workshop provided an overview of methods, but I would have like to have seen a dataset used that was closer to my own research so I would have a better idea of how to do manipulations.

WorkshopStrengths: The facilitators paid great attention to the different pace everyone was working at and was able to accommodate very well. It also very effectively built from basic best practices for data management to programming in R (a big jump, but not difficult).
WorkshopImprovements: It may have been helpful to budget time (maybe 1 hour at the end of each day) where participants could casually discuss their data sets with instructors and peers to get thinking about how they can apply the techniques in their own research. Despite this time not being built in, instructors were very accommodating in doing this on breaks.
InstructorsOpenEnded: During one of the breaks, both of the main instructors were enthusiastic when I approached them with my data set to discuss how could I apply some of what was taught to it.

WorkshopStrengths: easy to follow. good explanation. nice intructors.
WorkshopImprovements: when start to write scripts, it's better to slow down a bit.
InstructorsOpenEnded: when there are something went wrong with the scripts that I wrote, the instructors helped me to check the misstake patiently.

WorkshopStrengths: Good pace of new knowledge, good guidance, good supervisors/instructors, good buildup of knowledge
WorkshopImprovements: There was a problem with the file/data structure, which could be related to it being a new 'version' of the workshop. That cost some time, which caused us to not finish the entire initial schedule. Double checking this could prevent such an error in the future
InstructorsOpenEnded: The atmosphere was very pleasant, which made me comfortable asking any question I had. Also, I mentioned that I felt so slow at learning things on my own, compared to learning things from other people. Anita confirmed that she had experienced similar things in the past, which reassured me that we all need to learn new things and that always costs time. Made me feel more human and less ignorant.

WorkshopStrengths: It was a very hands-on workshop making it easier to directly apply what I learned for my own work.
User friendly, easy acces even to people with almost no programming background. While giving them enough handholds to really start going on their own
WorkshopImprovements: Time managment. Some parts of the workshop were just copy paste what the lecturer is doing. Instead of understanding what you are doing.
InstructorsOpenEnded: As soon as put up a red sticky, it was moments before an instructor came by and helped me trouble shoot my problems. Often even giving more (interresting) background information

WorkshopStrengths: it is much more practical
WorkshopImprovements: It is organised well
InstructorsOpenEnded: They help me to solve the errors happened in my command

WorkshopStrengths: well explained and precise
WorkshopImprovements: nothing to add
InstructorsOpenEnded: they were good

WorkshopStrengths: Nice course, good teachers, easy to ask for help or ask questions
WorkshopImprovements: #NAME?

WorkshopStrengths: hands on practice on writing scripts and running the entire pipeline. trouble-shooting in real-time
WorkshopImprovements: preparing to course in advance would have helped a lot. for instance reading up on unix and practicing basic commands would have made it easier during the worshop
InstructorsOpenEnded: not only did the instructors help me with trouble-shooting my scripts, but they also answered any questions that were raised during the workshop

WorkshopStrengths: the logical flow of tools
WorkshopImprovements: it was nearly impossible to keep up with the script.  To look at screen, type fix typos before the screen went away

WorkshopStrengths: Clarity of information available and help troubleshooting
WorkshopImprovements: Reference list of commonly used flags available beforehand
InstructorsOpenEnded: Jenn gave me extra resources to help learning coding and also gave me advice on how to move forward to incorporate coding into my future

WorkshopStrengths: very clear and easy to follow  repeating explanations throughout workshop is key
Exercises and challenges
Great workshop, very well designed lecture and very helpful hands on training.
WorkshopImprovements: Hope it can be longer than 2 days for us to learn more.
InstructorsOpenEnded: The instructor won't left anybody in trouble behind. Can help me to do troubleshooting almost immediately.

WorkshopStrengths: group size was small enough to get individual help when needed, but large enough for working to solve issues in small groups! interactive format was also very good.
WorkshopImprovements: A preview document with basic commands would be nice to review beforehand and have on hand when working.

WorkshopStrengths: Hands-on working with the datasets

Video provides a powerful way to help you prove your point. When you click Online Video, you can paste in the embed code for the video you want to add. You can also type a keyword to search online for the video that best fits your document. To make your document look professionally produced, Word provides header, footer, cover page, and text box designs that complement each other. For example, you can add a matching cover page, header, and sidebar. Click Insert and then choose the elements you want from the different galleries. Themes and styles also help keep your document coordinated. When you click Design and choose a new Theme, the pictures, charts, and SmartArt graphics change to match your new theme. When you apply styles, your headings change to match the new theme. Save time in Word with new buttons that show up where you need them.  To change the way a picture fits in your document, click it and a button for layout options appears next to it. When you work on a table, click where you want to add a row or a column, and then click the plus sign. Reading is easier, too, in the new Reading view. You can collapse parts of the document and focus on the text you want. If you need to stop reading before you reach the end, Word remembers where you left off - even on another device. practical examples  learn on the go  ongoing assistance

atmosphere, pace

WorkshopStrengths: low number of students, good schedule
WorkshopImprovements: maybe improve the part about the use of R

WorkshopStrengths: The fact that the teachers were in the same area and at similar levels ie. PhD and postdoc meant they could better understand what we might need  it was well thought out
small group of participants, exercise step by step, three tutors that could help every moment, friendly atmosphere
WorkshopImprovements: a little bit more focused at the genomic level. it could me nice to work with NGS data or a list of genes.  2,5 days are not enough. I would stay longer and learn more because the topic was perfectly fitting with my goals.

WorkshopStrengths: Good pace and learned how to use very interesting tools.
WorkshopImprovements: The course was more a basic R course than a "genomic course". I was actually interested in understanding how to show my NGS data.

WorkshopStrengths: small group and practical oriented programm
InstructorsOpenEnded: R notepad

WorkshopStrengths: small groups  speed of teaching good  very interactive

WorkshopImprovements: For me that knew knowing about programming it was really a fast pace to keep up with. I could sometimes not see on the screen whether it is a , or ! ect. The presenter was good but she assumed that we know something about programming. People who are allowed to do this workshop must be more or less on the same level regarding a basic knowledge of these kind or programmes.
InstructorsOpenEnded: They were always helpful and calm. I never felt that they were irritated when one of them helped me

WorkshopStrengths: The introduction to OpenRefine was very good and I will definitely use that more than R.     Although I do have a few comments for improvement, the workshop was all-in-all very good and I learned a lot.
WorkshopImprovements: Not all presenters were at a high standard. If someone asks a question and the answer is: "This is not in the lesson plan, I don't know" then I think the presenter does not really know the programme very well and only presents everything exactly as it is in the lesson plan.    Sometimes the pace was extremely slow and sometimes again too quick without any reference to what we are actually doing to try to understand the code. Often we only copied what the presenter did without understanding. My colleague next to me then started to ask the assistants the meaning of certain coding languages, as the presenter did not explain it. Since most participants have never worked with R , this type of context while you learn is extremely important.
InstructorsOpenEnded: The helpers (assistants) was very good, we could ask them anything. Ian van der Linde was also excellent. He often added something while others presented, to give more context or further explanation.

WorkshopStrengths: Patient presenters and helpers.
WorkshopImprovements: A bit more context before starting R programming, but otherwise, excellent.

WorkshopStrengths: Good and competent teachers,  nice atmosphere (place+inside group), interesting program
InstructorsOpenEnded: Problem was quickly solved with hands on

WorkshopStrengths: the workshop is very youthful
WorkshopImprovements: it better if the workshop day is maximized to one week
AccessibilityResponse: internet problem
InstructorsOpenEnded: there are very interactive with the trainers

WorkshopStrengths: the interactive and useful way R is taught (I attended to several introduction to R, it has never been that useful), I was also very happy to discover knit that I will likely use in the future
WorkshopImprovements: avoiding spending to much time on excel problems, proposing longer exercices with a workflow that cover all what we learned  (not only the last command), a practical like that could better represent situations of our daily work

WorkshopStrengths: Direct typing exercises on own notebook  the great teachers, with excellent R knowledge
WorkshopImprovements: Shorten the introduction on excel, this is way too basic.  could show bad examples and present the solutions in one hour, but not half a day.
InstructorsOpenEnded: they answered all our questions and showed how to address these in R

WorkshopStrengths: nice atmosphere  nice overview of new methods and things  insight into how to deal with data
WorkshopImprovements: Little more Differentiation between more and less advanced students. Extra Tasks for faster students for example. This way slower students have the time to catch up but dont miss new things.   More challenges to actually use with what we learned.   More interaction.

WorkshopStrengths: variety of topics covered
WorkshopImprovements: some aims could have been more clear

WorkshopImprovements: bringing your own messy data

WorkshopStrengths: Good venue, organisation.
number of instructors, doing it on our own computer
InstructorsOpenEnded: they were extremely helpful and good with trouble shooting

WorkshopStrengths: The knowledge that is imparted is extremely important and needs to be known by researchers. It is very good to see people taking their time to actually impart such skills. The technical aspects relating to the software are covered in a detailed manner and this is very good. The use of a number of assistants is a huge bonus as well. The use of knowlegeable presenters and assistants is big strength as well.
WorkshopImprovements: The workshops need to be spread over more days. The content was compressed into a 2.5 day period and this was just not sufficient. As a result the presenter (for R in partcular) therefore had to rush through the material. I believe that this was not conducive for learning purposes. Although there were helpers to assist people it was impossible to catch up after falling behind because the lesson would continue whilst the 'slow people' were still being assisted. So the idea of having people complete tasks whilst simultaneously following the lesson should probably be changed - unless the workshop is spread out over more days.
InstructorsOpenEnded: The helpers assisted me on multiple occasions very graciously without any complaints. They were super polite and professional throughout the entire period.

WorkshopStrengths: presenter was outgoing and patient
WorkshopImprovements: go slower but also need more time
AccessibilityResponse: the pc could not handle the prgram
InstructorsOpenEnded: found my mistakes and corrected it for the one could not work with out the other/previous code.

WorkshopStrengths: Openrefine is useful. Session was presented well, all aspects of the lesson was clear.
WorkshopImprovements: Relating to R:I am glad there are notes, thank you - but without those I would not know how to do any of the work we were taught. I am not sure how this can be improved.

WorkshopStrengths: pace was good, help was always there, eposure to what can be
WorkshopImprovements: Obviously a longer workshop would give more time, explaining for Rstudios the applications by examples.
InstructorsOpenEnded: Pointing out the importance of accuracy  Using previous mistakes e.g. survey vs surveys and working with it  "getwd"

WorkshopStrengths: Provided skills relevant to the current demands of the information and  data processing ecosystem
WorkshopImprovements: More time for facilitation of programmes like R
InstructorsOpenEnded: They tried their best to provide as much information to the participants

WorkshopStrengths: multiple facilitators,knowledgeable facilitators
WorkshopImprovements: split the participants according to the levels of expertise. I think participants with more knowledge felt the pace was to slow.  Follow up info/session would be great as to not be a waste /loss of knowledge
InstructorsOpenEnded: Amy, Angelique and John and Ian was verfy helpful.I could at any point asked and helped. OpenRefine was very interesting as well as RStudio

WorkshopStrengths: It actually was a lot of fun, very useful intro for beginners in this sort of data management! I liked the vibe of the workshop and the "sticky" idea... Great instructors :)
WorkshopImprovements: If the workshop was a bit longer, it would be nice to have an intro session for R terms and functions etc. such as was done in OpenRefine. The pace should also not be too quick in R sessions, so that beginners don't get lost or forget what the idea behind the coding was...
InstructorsOpenEnded: They made things clear for me when I asked questions or got stuck... The environment is conducive for asking questions and speaking up when you when you are wondering about something...

WorkshopImprovements: Pace should be reduced to encourage more learning and understanding.
InstructorsOpenEnded: Instructor was way too fast at times and I ended up just doing things instead of learning what the actually mean or how they work. Really felt lost at times.

WorkshopImprovements: go through basics of R - longer workshop just on R, but distinguish between true beginners and those that have some experience.

WorkshopStrengths: 1. Hands on  2. Full time assistance  3. relaxed atmosphere
WorkshopImprovements: 1. Perhaps more prior reading materials to those willing  2. Perhaps follow up workshop
InstructorsOpenEnded: Looked at my code and pointed out the error in it. This was cool

WorkshopStrengths: Very informative  excellent presentation  Good workshop organisation  Good time management  Learner friendly
WorkshopImprovements: Provide alternative refreshments to coffee

WorkshopStrengths: well structured and extremely informative.
WorkshopImprovements: it could be generated over a longer period to cover more content.
InstructorsOpenEnded: all instructors were enthusiastic and well informed on what was being presented, which made the learning process fun and easy to participate in.

WorkshopStrengths: I enjoyed the open Refine section of the workshop. it will help immensely in my environment. With regards to the R section, I find it extremely useful and have thought of a number of ideas of where I can implement it.
WorkshopImprovements: The facilitator of the R section was slightly to teacher-like  and strict and it almost felt rigid. I would suggest a more relaxed way of presenting or perhaps allocate more time for R to be taught.
InstructorsOpenEnded: The OpenRefine section provided a streamlined way of doing data cleanup and sorting. I found the relaxed demeanour of the instructor more conducive to learning and I did not feel lost or confused at any point.

WorkshopStrengths: It make openrefine and R accessible
WorkshopImprovements: it is already well built, difficult to add more from a learner perspective

WorkshopImprovements: timing could be improved. add a 30 minute intro on what will be covered in r and how you aim to accomplish it
InstructorsOpenEnded: I found that Ian was very patient and extremely knowledgeable. I preferred Amy's presentation style. Angelique was a bit fast but she adapted her style. I enjoyed Jacques presentation.

WorkshopStrengths: Clarity  Good instructors  Well organized  Team of instructors
WorkshopImprovements: More time  Online videos to watch beforehand

WorkshopStrengths: I appreciate the hands-on, helpful teaching techniques the instructors used! The green stickies/pink stickies were so helpful. The instructors were so responsive and helpful.
WorkshopImprovements: I had a lot of trouble with the SQLite stuff as the instructor seemed a little less interested in using the techniques that the other instructors did (e.g. green stickies)    I think more instances of think-pair-share would be helpful. People HATE sharing in a large group environment, so giving people the opportunity to share in smaller groups would make people more prone to speaking about their problems/concerns.
InstructorsOpenEnded: The instructors were very conscious about people falling behind or having problems and would try to slow down or stop to explain.

WorkshopStrengths: Diversity of folks in the room resulted in exposure to solutions that I wouldn't otherwise have considered.  Instructors were all very knowledgeable. There was always a good chance that someone in the room had a solution to any problem.  The workshop makes you dedicate time to getting started with a programming language (half the battle is finding time) and also provides helpful resources for moving forward, this gives me more confidence.
WorkshopImprovements: At times some of the areas could have benefited from a little more background on why we were running a certain script, what it does and to be put in context of when it might be useful. There were a couple of times I found myself blindly typing a command, which isn't useful. More time to work with real data may also be a helpful exercise.
InstructorsOpenEnded: they made me feel at ease with the struggles that I have experienced learning a programming language so far and provided resources to get help. This made me realise my experience is normal and gave me confidence to keep learning.

WorkshopImprovements: The Python session was quite confusing. We needed more explanation of the basic concepts and building blocks of the language before being expected to follow what was going on.

I asked my question, and got a clear and concise explanation which made it much easier to follow what was going on.

WorkshopStrengths: Having attended prior workshops, this one in my opinion was the only "complete" workshop of them all. From working with raw spreadsheets/data through to generating publishable/accurate graphs and figures. It creates a suburb platform for entry level learners, also facilitating further self/group learning. Very well done to the organizers.

WorkshopStrengths: This workshop was an absolute disaster. Ian assumed an incredible amount of prior knowledge on Python, leading to frustration among the majority of attendees. When we could not get the files to open on my computer, those who claim to be good on computers advised me to just sit and do nothing for the remaining 4.5 hours of the workshop.
WorkshopImprovements: This was a total waste of my time and I will be sure to advise everyone in my department to avoid these workshops at all cost.
InstructorsOpenEnded: Ian was possibly the worst instructor I have had in any workshop, course, learning environment ever. Mumbling to the point of being inaudible, failure to make eye contact with participants, assumption of extensive prior knowledge in Python (he didn't even explain what Terminal is, how to open it, and why we use Terminal to communicate with our machines). There were no checks along the way to determine if students had accomplished the goals set out in order to build mastery and confidence. The instructors implemented a system with post-it notes whereby you would adhere a red post it note to your computer if you were having issues. As the necessary files would not open on my fully functioning, brand new computer, I adhered a red post it to my machine for hours and sat, unable to follow the exercises, for the remaining 4.5 hours of the workshop. The first day was such a frustrating waste of time that I elected to not attend the second day. All of your instructors have a lot to learn about teaching.

WorkshopStrengths: Introducing new software. Not sure some of them will help my research. But is was interesting to learn about them.
It was great that we learned various different things (OpenRefine, SQL, Python)  The helpers that were there were very nice and helpful.
WorkshopImprovements: The Python part was way too difficult and hard to follow..it would have been great to have much more practical examples. Also, there was no discussion of how to store the Python data / variable names / get a good overview of all Python analysis that was done, which I felt was therefore not reproducible.
InstructorsOpenEnded: I thought it was nice to see that not all instructors had all answers - but they could help in showing me how to find a solution when you encounter such a problem (which was helpful for the future)

WorkshopStrengths: The SQL portion was very well taught.
WorkshopImprovements: The instructor during the Python portion entered code too quickly and began speaking well before students had time to finish entering code.
InstructorsOpenEnded: The instructor for SQL clearly had an excellent handle on the material and did an excellent job of teaching the material.

WorkshopStrengths: I thought the instruction was really good and I enjoyed learning about helpful programs I had never used such as OpenRefine and SQLite
WorkshopImprovements: I would have preferred to focus on fewer programs that we could have learned in greater detail. I felt there was too much switching around.

WorkshopStrengths: The Open Refine section and overview of how to curate data were helpful and pitched at the right level for me, but the bits on Python were over my head. I felt I was just copying and pasting or typing what the instructor put on the screen, and wasn't always understanding what I was doing.
WorkshopImprovements: The OpenRefine and SQLite work could have occupied more of the workshop. I felt I could do more with this (more that I understood anyway) than in the terminal.
InstructorsOpenEnded: The instructors speaking about data curation, OpenRefine and SQLite had helpful slides and were engaged and engaging.

WorkshopStrengths: Diversity of applications
WorkshopImprovements: Introductions providing basic information
InstructorsOpenEnded: Answer questions during the break

WorkshopStrengths: Wide coverage and introduction to varioussoftware
WorkshopImprovements: R sessions need to be slowed down

WorkshopStrengths: ability to practice
WorkshopImprovements: the 2nd day of R teaching of dpylr needed improvement.  The dplyr was burned through at a pace and with insufficient explanation of what the commands do. At that pace, homework prior to coming in needed to be given. The ggplot was explained well, BUT the instructor kept taking away the code to show us a huge picture of a graph. Resizing is ok, but keep the code up (!) . We can see the dang graph on our own computers, assuming we can get the code typed in.
InstructorsOpenEnded: The first day there was a helper that was not here on  the second day. He helped me get connected (security issues made it hard to get on),  he looked at my code and taught me simple but wonderful things - like how the pipe in R is not a pipe - like in bash (that was worth the trip). I did not appreciate the R instructor the next day. Pace was wrong. She spent time talking up the main instructor and was not much interested in helping.

I ended up frantically copying what was on the screen rather than having any time to undertsand what I was typing. But obviously there is a lot to fit into two days and you want to cover as much as possible (and so do I!) but it was at a vastly different pace from the whole rest of the workshop, with a lot more to understand and yet much less time allowed for it.

WorkshopStrengths: The FLOSS software covered in the workshop.  The trainers and helpers.  The pre-workshop software setup - saved a lot of time on the days. Being able to use your own laptop so that you already have all the software installed after the course.  The online documentation.  The venue and refreshments were good too.
WorkshopImprovements: The software setup could be fine-tuned.  Explaining how to work with code, never easy, but it was the most challenging part of the workshop.  Venue was very cold.

WorkshopStrengths: A vast array of topics were covered. The etherpad made checking the script possible
WorkshopImprovements: Our instructor rachel Schwarz flew through the material without providing a strong basis. I have worked with programming languages before as a hobby but could not keep up and simultaneously understand what was happening. I have pity on those with no experience.   To my mind the purpose of having an instructor is to interact with the material and be guided last vommon misunderstandings by an expert. Ms Schwarz moved so quickly and spent so little time explaining I may as well have just watched a video and read stack exchange.   I truly felt the workshop was only barely worth the money... I could have taught myself everything we covered.   In contrast some of the other staff seemed not only more knowledgeable but also more willing to help.   I highly recommend replacing ms. Schwarz if possible.

WorkshopStrengths: Very useful aspects of R and SQL language were covered (even if not in the best manner); Having GitHub linked to the professor's Rstudio code was a plus (even if it was taking very long time to be updated); The use of etherpad was also helpful; having the food in the same room allowed more time efficiency; helpers were also very good.
WorkshopImprovements: Less time with spreadsheet part, or even removing it at all. Slow down specially when most of the group wasn't following the code and the helpers were all around talking but the professor kept talking further anyways; The SQL part could be better addressed, it wasn't really motivating and many people left; Having the github code for all the sections and updated more frequently.
InstructorsOpenEnded: Sometimes most of the group was having issues, the helpers would be around trying to help but the professor kept moving forward.  The SQL and spreadsheet parts were specially confusing and not so motivating.

WorkshopStrengths: constant help with questions, covered a wide variety of topics, interesting graph features were covered (like the color palettes for visually impaired)
WorkshopImprovements: Start with the basics, don't assume people know anything yet, slow down on the more complicated stuff, maybe have a starting project that people can download ahead of time the has simple lines to be run so people get an idea of how it works ahead of time

WorkshopStrengths: I needed some basic exposure to both R and SQL.
WorkshopImprovements: Longer would be better, or stick to one topic (e.g., R or SQL). And I still like to be able to look things up in a book, so a list of good basic references would be helpful.

WorkshopStrengths: The Excel tips were useful, the instructors were also good and knowledgable about the material.The material was useful especially learning how to make plots in R.
WorkshopImprovements: Even though the workshop said you needed no prior knowledge of R, I thought it was taught in a way that made it seem like should have had some previous knowledge. The commands, jargin and syntax were tossed out pretty casually without a lot of previous explanation. Someone who has not had previous experience with programming doesn't know what things like "is.na" and "=True vs =False" and "!" mean or how they are used. Trying to catch onto things like this while also following everything else made it difficult to keep up.
InstructorsOpenEnded: The extra helpers were really great because otherwise it would be very easy to get lost and not be able to catch back up or have to slow down the whole class while one student caught back up.

WorkshopStrengths: Enthusiastic instructors and assistants who were very patient with us!   This was a mixed ability group and I appreciated the differentiated challenges set up by Dr. Schwartz. The Etherpad and Dr.Shchwartz posting the scripts live her github was very helpful!  The SQL past was awesome, it was delivered at a more gentle pace compared to R.
WorkshopImprovements: Perhaps spend less time on excel in order to slow down and devote more time to R.
InstructorsOpenEnded: On several occasions, I got frustrated because the script was not working. The helpers patiently went through my script and pointed that everything was in order and gently told that there was a typo that need to be fixed.

WorkshopStrengths: Challenge Questions
InstructorsOpenEnded: All of the instructors were very helpful!

WorkshopStrengths: The information was provided clearly
WorkshopImprovements: There is a lot of information provided. By the end of the day (somewhere around 3 pm), I could no longer focus on the topic. Although lunch and breaks were given, challenges were assigned during these times. For myself, that had very little familiarity with R, it was too much information in too short of a time without a chance to stretch my legs, so to speak. I would suggest a shorter day, at least for the first part of the program or maybe spend less time on Excel so that R can be taken at a slower pace.

WorkshopStrengths: Program was great in introducing tons of information in regards to R, or for filling in gaps of knowledge.
WorkshopImprovements: Check in every once and a while to make sure all participants are current with code, sometimes the cursor on the screen moved way to fast to follow what was actually happening. A list of commands and functions would have been helpful to have, as well for the challenges. Might be useful to change the space so that it is easier to work in smaller groups rather than pairs?

WorkshopStrengths: the workshop host/leaders were knowledgeable and eager to help participants
WorkshopImprovements: I would shorten it by two hours, I really had trouble grasping material at the end of the workshop. Or just have the last two hours be group work where we use all the skills learned. Something where we get data, fix any bad formatting, then apply the codes taught.
InstructorsOpenEnded: I think they took into consideration the level everyone might be on to answer questions and provide examples. For example, the data sheet used to determine better formatting was set to mimic how biologist might store data realistically.

WorkshopStrengths: I really enjoyed this workshop and got a lot more out of it than I anticipated.
WorkshopImprovements: Python!! I use GIS and would love to see a Python workshop.
Instructors can slow down a little bit, and give more time to students to digest the materials.

WorkshopStrengths: A lot of material was covered and it got me up to speed where I can now work on teaching myself the basics of R. This workshop helped to make R more approachable and I hope to incorporate it into my data analysis practices in the future
WorkshopImprovements: It would be a lot easier to digest if we started out with a very small data set for the first hour or so, just so I can flip back and forth between seeing the entire data set and using R functions. By working only with large datasets, it took longer to catch on. Not only was I learning all the functions of R, but I was also trying to remember all of the variables that were included with the data.
InstructorsOpenEnded: I was able to ask questions when I fell behind and a helper was able to pick out my mistakes and get me back on track with little disruption

WorkshopStrengths: good teacher-student engagement
WorkshopImprovements: spend less time on introduction/excel and more time on R training

WorkshopStrengths: Learned about some of R's capabilities
WorkshopImprovements: I feel that the first day of R went too fast. Once I typed a code wrong and had to troubleshoot I fell behind and had a hard time catching up.  The etherboard script was not updating in good enough real time to help me out.  Sometimes it did not refresh for 10-15 mins which really put me behind.  It would have been great to  have handouts of some of the basic coding terms.  I know they were online but again flipping back and forth on my laptop slowed me down and I fell behind even more.  The plotting with R section moved at a better pace.

WorkshopStrengths: Easy introduction to R language
WorkshopImprovements: Maybe SQL and R be excluded into two separate workshops

WorkshopStrengths: The presenters were knowledgeable.  The green and blue stickies worked well for signalling.  The sessions started and ended on time
WorkshopImprovements: Presenters who have typed n lines should not then go back and change line n-k.  Doing so makes note taking difficult.  If line n-k needs correcting, comment it out and enter the corrected version  as line n+1.  If line n-k is a building block for an longer line, copy it, paste it to line n+1 and added the other building blocks for the longer line there.    The presentations on Excel and SQL were frustrating because the clicking of icons was sometimes too rapid to follow and then  difficult to reconstruct.  If point-and-click software must be used, the workshop should include handouts listing the sequence of clicks required to achieve desired effects.
InstructorsOpenEnded: The presenter on Excel and SQL was too often vague and far too often padded sentences with "sort of," "kind of," "generally," "like," "you know".

WorkshopStrengths: the food was awesome!
WorkshopImprovements: It often felt like there were many conversations going on around the classroom. I understand that the 'helpers' are pivotal but it was extremely hard to follow at times because of this.

WorkshopStrengths: multiple patient instructors. in-class example problems. Etherpad!
WorkshopImprovements: class over course of three days. Noticed that by hour 5 or 6, I got a bit overwhelmed. Esp. in the R section. Another option would be pre-reading/exerceises on excel and SQL sections to save time in class.
InstructorsOpenEnded: I believe you need to review a new concept a few times before it sinks in. That might have been hard given the pace of the class. But the number of patient instructors and classmates circumvented that issue.     When the instructor at the front of the class gave a brief explanation of vectors that left me confused. The two instructors at the back of the class (one an EPA scientist and the other a data librarian) offered two more detailed answers. Then I peeked over my seatmate's shoulder to catch up on material I missed while getting clarification.

WorkshopStrengths: Having multiple helpers  Explaining terminology when asked
WorkshopImprovements: Slow down a little, though I know some people have prior experience  Less detail about databases
InstructorsOpenEnded: Cleared up some confusion I had

InstructorsOpenEnded: there was always someone available to answer questions so you can follow the class all the time.

WorkshopStrengths: Good pacing of lessons and breaks.
WorkshopImprovements: The final lesson was a little rushed due to timing.
InstructorsOpenEnded: Very receptive to my confusion about certain aspects.  The instructor made sure everyone was caught up before moving on with the lesson.

InstructorsOpenEnded: I enjoyed meeting and interacting with all of the instructors.  I appreciated the instructors providing all students with future resources for student data needs, highlighting their current strengths and research.

WorkshopStrengths: Insightful, opens a window to future learning.
good selection of topics and hands-on examples
WorkshopImprovements: the pace of progression (I know it is hard with many people), a longer lunch break
InstructorsOpenEnded: an instructor quickly available upon having a question

WorkshopStrengths: good introduction, good challenge examples and encouraging group work
WorkshopImprovements: too much time spent in very basic introductory elements, then rushing through heavy lifting.
InstructorsOpenEnded: there were lots of helpers at the ready to come look and find your typo or simple error, and otherwise work with you for understanding.

WorkshopStrengths: good instructors, good excercises , relevant examples
WorkshopImprovements: hard to improve without more time! the workshop was a good balance of breadth of material although depth is obviously limited by time available

WorkshopStrengths: Actually having a dataset to work with really helped, I liked the challenges a lot because I got to learn hands-on what to do.
WorkshopImprovements: Some of the lessons were very condensed and fast for new learners. I felt like the red/green cards for help worked in theory, but didn't work well when someone was teaching because none of the helpers were looking for red cards during lectures.
InstructorsOpenEnded: One of the helpers, Sarah, was able to talk to me specifically about how these tools relate to my research.

WorkshopStrengths: Good introduction to people with little experience

Information was very well presented and at a good pace. Challenges/exercises were relevant and informative. Instructors/helps were knowledgeable, helpful, and approachable. I learned a lot of basic functions, but I think the take away was that there are a LOT of resources to help me apply it to my specific work. This was a really impressive free workshop, and I'd recommend it to anyone interested in learning better ways to handle their data. Also the snacks were good
WorkshopImprovements: I wish we had more time/organization with R markup and to complete the capstone project (and review)
InstructorsOpenEnded: I had a specific issue with my computer downloading a package I needed, and Brian helped sort it out immediately so I didn't miss anything.   Alex was also excellent at answering questions about what he was covering.  The instructors/helpers were all great

WorkshopStrengths: the first day, teaching is good.
WorkshopImprovements: start with basic, step by step, the instructor showed so many command and function at a time, I could not understand easily.
InstructorsOpenEnded: The problem instructor gave us, she could not solve the problem by herself. so it is tough for a new learner.

WorkshopStrengths: - the well-organized workshop,  - well-described target group of students (researchers),  - experienced, opened-minded, and motivating mentors,  - nice atmosphere to learn and to focus on the exercises,  - the exercises prepared for all topics,  - learning materials available at Github,  - many additional materials in the Data Carpentry's Github repository.
WorkshopImprovements: - maybe it will be a good idea to take short breaks a bit more often  - you can add some homework if the workshop lasts 2 or more days
InstructorsOpenEnded: The instructors answered all questions which I had. They were very helpful and patient. They motivated me to spread an idea of Software Carpentry between my colleagues. I hope to do it in the nearest future.

WorkshopStrengths: the politeness and punctuality of the trainer  your confidentiality
WorkshopImprovements: the time giving is not enough to cover all the data analysis  so the length of time could be added additional day.if it is so all thing was be alright.

WorkshopStrengths: Many people were available to help, all of the instructors were patient and had good attitudes, all of the instructors tried to make sure their topics were understood. It was nice to have the data carpentry website to follow along.
WorkshopImprovements: Although the data carpentry website was useful, a few (1-3) powerpoint slides to introduce the main foundations/purposes of each topic prior to beginning coding would be helpful.

WorkshopStrengths: This workshop was very well organized. Plenty of help was available. The coordinators were enthusiastic and positive. Great food.
Great information covered. It was a comfortable environment for learning the material. The presenters and helpers were well versed in the material they were teaching.
WorkshopImprovements: More time is needed to complete the material, we rushed through almost the ending of the sessions. It may be helpful to include an additional day for beginners since at some point I did not want to ask questions to keep others back when we were short on time in the end.
InstructorsOpenEnded: Justin started off his session including notes in his r lesson, which made it easy to follow and take my own notes as well. However, as the lesson progressed notes decreases which made the very last part to follow. But otherwise it was awesome.    Henry was able to provide great real life examples to help make the info relatable, as in why should I pay attention to SQL.

WorkshopStrengths: The working environment and and interaction of speaker was very nice
WorkshopImprovements: time should be more
InstructorsOpenEnded: things were more clear and my skilll are improved now

WorkshopStrengths: The instructors were knowledgable, enthusiastic and helpful.
WorkshopImprovements: For beginners, instructors need to repeat things more often because otherwise beginners get lost at the start of a particular example/problem/lesson and it's harder to catch up.
InstructorsOpenEnded: As a beginner, sometimes I got stuck in the most basic parts where it more or less was expected to be known- whenever I had those simple questions they were promptly and graciously answered; I was able to then keep up and learn more.

WorkshopStrengths: access to the lesson materials and epad for future reference to get correct everything that I missed in the previous questions.
